We love a good mystery thriller and this latest Netflix offering looks great.

Netflix has released a trailer for their new mystery Rattlesnake which looks all kinds of scary.

The footage shows off a mother (Alien Covenant star Carmen Ejogo) who finds her child placed in grave peril and is forced to make a dark deal, and it only seems to escalate from there!

The official plot synopsis reads: "Katrina is a single mother driving cross country to start a new life with her young daughter Clara (Apollonia Pratt) when their car breaks down in the middle of nowhere.

"As Katrina changes the tire, Clara wanders off the desert road and is bitten by a venomous rattlesnake. Desperate to save her daughter’s life, Katrina accepts the help of a mysterious woman, but after she miraculously heals Clara, Katrina is asked to repay the good deed by killing a stranger in exchange for the life saved.

"Without time to lose, she must wrestle with the morality of who deserves to live and who should die, before her daughter’s life is once again put in peril at sundown."

(Image: YOUTUBE/NETFLIX)

Well, we look forward to watching this and not sleeping, as some of the shots in this trailer alone look very unnerving.

Netflix is currently enjoying huge viewing numbers for some of its most acclaimed shows, with recent drama miniseries Unbelievable proving to get huge viewing numbers in its first month of release.

(Image: YOUTUBE/NETFLIX)

Will Rattlesnake prove another hit for the streaming giant?

Rattlesnake is released on Netflix on October 25, 2019.

Will you be watching new thriller Rattlesnake on Netflix? Let us know in the comments below.
description: Carmen Ejogo stars in the new survivalist horror nightmare Rattlesnake on Netflix
